intro: Erycibe albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
